business_health.text: Pharmaceutical giant Pfizer reports record quarterly profits as new weight-loss drug gains FDA approval, sending stock prices soaring 15% in morning trading.
business_health.explanation: Combines corporate financial performance with medical/health product approval

business_health.text: Healthcare insurance companies face massive losses as new regulations require coverage of mental health services, forcing industry-wide restructuring and layoffs.
business_health.explanation: Insurance business impact from healthcare policy changes

business_health.text: Telemedicine startup raises $500 million in Series C funding to expand virtual doctor consultations across rural America, addressing healthcare accessibility gaps.
Major hospital chains report bankruptcy filings as rising operational costs and nurse shortages create unsustainable financial pressures across the healthcare sector.
Biotech company stock crashes 40% after clinical trial failure for experimental Alzheimer's treatment, wiping out $3 billion in market value overnight.
Amazon announces acquisition of primary care provider One Medical for $3.9 billion, expanding tech giant's footprint in healthcare delivery services.
Medical device manufacturer recalls defective pacemakers affecting 50,000 patients, facing potential billion-dollar lawsuits and regulatory sanctions from FDA.
business_health.explanation: Product safety issue with business and health implications

business_health.text: Private equity firms invest heavily in dental clinic chains, raising concerns about profit-driven care compromising patient treatment quality and accessibility.
Gym membership sales surge 35% as employers offer wellness program subsidies to reduce healthcare costs and improve worker productivity.
business_health.explanation: Fitness industry growth tied to corporate health initiatives

business_health.text: Generic drug manufacturers face antitrust investigation for price-fixing schemes that inflated medication costs by 1000%, affecting millions of patients nationwide.

business_entertainment.text: Disney reports streaming subscriber losses for third consecutive quarter, prompting 7,000 layoffs across film studios and theme park divisions.
business_entertainment.explanation: Entertainment company financial performance and corporate restructuring

business_entertainment.text: Taylor Swift's Eras Tour generates $2 billion in ticket revenue, becoming highest-grossing concert series in history and boosting local economies across 50 cities.
business_entertainment.explanation: Entertainment event with major economic impact

business_entertainment.text: Hollywood writers and actors strike for 148 days over streaming residuals and AI concerns, costing entertainment industry estimated $5 billion in lost production.
Netflix stock plummets 35% after announcing password-sharing crackdown backfires, losing 2 million subscribers and $15 billion in market capitalization.
business_entertainment.explanation: Streaming business strategy impacting financial performance

business_entertainment.text: Warner Bros. Discovery writes down $9 billion in assets, cancels completed films for tax breaks, sparking outrage among filmmakers and industry professionals.
business_entertainment.explanation: Corporate financial decisions affecting entertainment content

business_entertainment.text: Video game industry layoffs exceed 10,000 workers as major publishers prioritize live-service games over single-player experiences, reshaping development landscape.
business_entertainment.explanation: Gaming industry business strategy and workforce impact

business_entertainment.text: Broadway theaters report record-breaking $1.8 billion season revenue as post-pandemic audiences return, with Hamilton alone grossing $3 million weekly.
Spotify raises subscription prices 20% while reducing artist royalty payments, drawing criticism from musicians and antitrust scrutiny from regulators.
business_entertainment.explanation: Music streaming business model affecting artists

business_entertainment.text: AMC Theatres files Chapter 11 bankruptcy as streaming services and declining attendance force closure of 200 locations nationwide.
Sony acquires Crunchyroll for $1.2 billion, consolidating anime streaming market and raising concerns about monopolistic control over Japanese animation distribution.

health_entertainment.text: Professional athletes speak out about mental health struggles, with Olympic gymnast Simone Biles withdrawing from competition to prioritize psychological well-being.
Documentary exploring America's opioid crisis wins Oscar, featuring interviews with addiction survivors and families devastated by pharmaceutical company negligence.
health_entertainment.explanation: Entertainment content focused on health crisis

health_entertainment.text: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver launches campaign against childhood obesity, producing cooking shows teaching families healthy meal preparation on limited budgets.
Netflix series '13 Reasons Why' linked to increased teen suicide rates by researchers, prompting mental health warnings and content modifications.
health_entertainment.explanation: Entertainment content affecting mental health outcomes

health_entertainment.text: Professional esports players suffer repetitive strain injuries and burnout, leading to mandatory health breaks and ergonomic requirements in competitive gaming.
Broadway star reveals cancer diagnosis during performance, using platform to advocate for early screening and healthcare access for performing artists.
Music festival implements harm reduction strategies including drug testing and medical tents after overdose deaths, balancing entertainment with public health.
Reality TV show 'The Biggest Loser' faces criticism from medical experts for promoting unhealthy rapid weight loss and contributing to eating disorders.
Professional dancers develop chronic pain and eating disorders due to industry pressures, prompting calls for better healthcare support in performing arts.
Meditation and wellness apps featuring celebrity voices generate $4 billion annually, as stars like LeBron James promote mental health through guided relaxation.
